channel.title: Comments on: SharePoint Designer wrongfully says a file is checked out when it is not

item.title: By: Emmy Eastwood
item.dc:creator: Emmy Eastwood
item.description: I actually went to the document's properties and clicked on Remove Properties and Personal Information. That seems to have worked. But I am not an expert.
item.content:encoded: I actually went to the document’s properties and clicked on Remove Properties and Personal Information. That seems to have worked. But I am not an expert.

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: It worked with SharePoint Designer 2013. You guys are the number one life savers, thanks!
item.content:encoded: It worked with SharePoint Designer 2013. You guys are the number one life savers, thanks!

item.title: By: Nate
item.dc:creator: Nate
item.description: This resolved same issue in SharePoint Online 2013. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: This resolved same issue in SharePoint Online 2013. Thanks!

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: You, sir, are a SharePoint god.

item.title: By: batyandres

item.description: thank you very much Randy, was very helpful
item.content:encoded: thank you very much Randy, was very helpful

item.title: By: Emmanuel
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel
item.description: You can try a Ctrl + F5 in designer and it will be ok<br /><br />Emmanuel
item.content:encoded:
You can try a Ctrl + F5 in designer and it will be ok

Emmanuel

item.title: By: WYLIESHADOW
item.dc:creator: WYLIESHADOW
item.description: I had this same issue with Designer2007. When working with a master page, after a while it began hanging on to this 'checked out' status and would give me trouble when trying to make further edits. I was editing/testing this master page and so i needed to constantly check in/out and when this glitch started it became a real pain. I didn't fix it but worked around it by closing the document, and then reopening the document which would clear the 'checked out' status, and then would be able check out again.
item.content:encoded: I had this same issue with Designer2007. When working with a master page, after a while it began hanging on to this ‘checked out’ status and would give me trouble when trying to make further edits. I was editing/testing this master page and so i needed to constantly check in/out and when this glitch started it became a real pain. I didn’t fix it but worked around it by closing the document, and then reopening the document which would clear the ‘checked out’ status, and then would be able check out again.
